Discussed: 1) Anxiety about CS mixer elevator pitch, 2) Student loan stress impacting grad school plans, 3) Difficulty approaching professor mentors. Solutions: Structured pitch framework, study group practice sessions ('Code & Converse Wednesdays'), cookie-bribed feedback, loan management meeting scheduling, and strategic professor outreach tactics. Student responded enthusiastically: Created shared recording drive, scheduled financial meeting, drafted mentor email, and reframed anxiety as excitement. Progress evidenced by concrete systems implementation (regular practice group, financial planning) and proactive outreach steps (Dr. Chen email draft).

Gregory sought help for 1) networking anxiety (CS mixer pitch), 2) financial stress (student loans), and 3) mentor outreach (approaching Dr. Chen). Solutions offered included: a structured 3-part pitch formula, transforming his study group into a practice lab ('Code & Converse Wednesdays'), loan management strategies, and scripted professor outreach phrases. Gregory enthusiastically implemented solutions by: creating shared practice resources (Google Drive), scheduling financial aid meetings, and drafting outreach messages. Evidence of improvement includes: reframing anxiety as excitement, establishing peer accountability systems, taking concrete steps toward mentorship, and developing humor as a coping mechanism ('Dr. Cookie-Coder' persona).

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Gregory discussed stress about student loans during grad school applications, nervousness about an elevator pitch for a CS networking event, and fear of approaching professor Dr. Chen. Solutions included a structured pitch formula, transforming his study group into a professional practice lab ('Code & Converse'), and specific scripts for mentor outreach. Gregory enthusiastically implemented all solutions: created shared Google Drive for practice recordings, emailed loan servicer, scheduled financial meetings, and drafted research-specific questions for Dr. Chen. Evidence of progress includes establishing weekly skills labs, taking financial initiative, and developing presentation metaphors. His anxiety decreased as he shifted from avoidance to proactive problem-solving, using humor and peer support systems.
